distorOrdPrc.resFees: Subject to area and attributes required. See http://www.macaulayscientific.com/gis2_dataset_1a.php

dataIdInfo.idAbs: The National Soils Inventory for Scotland (NSIS1) dataset presented here has been collected using sampling points arranged as a 10 km grid. A wide range of attributes are described, measured and analysed for each site. These range from contextual information describing the surrounding landscape (such as slope and vegetation), down to detailed chemical analyses of each horizon within the soil profile. There are 721 sites in total where soil occurs; where there is no soil at a particular 10 km sampling point, this point has not been included.
dataIdInfo.idPurp: An inventory of Scotland's soils at a 10 kilometre interval.
dataIdInfo.idCredit: Soil Survey of Scotland Staff. (1981). The James Hutton Institute (2014).
dataIdInfo.envirDesc: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.1.1.3143

Consts.useLimit: This data is point data, 1:250,000 polygon data for the whole of Scotland is also available. This data is available under licence from Scotland's Soils website and it is free of charge for non-commercial purposes. Data may not be redistributed or shared without an appropriate license. For commercial use of this data please contact the James Hutton Institute for licensing information. Publication without a publishing license is a breach of copyright.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

overview.eaover: Comma separated column descriptions: COLUMN_NAME,NSIS_1 proforma_name,COMMENTS MV_PROFILE_DATA_NSIS1_10KM_ID,,Unique identifier for row in MV_PROFILE_DATA_NSIS1_10KM. Use this field as a unique identifier for links to MS Access or if setting up an external database. PROFILE_NGR,,Profile pit location by GPS Ordnance Survey National Grid Reference (NGR) EASTING,,Easting in metres from the false origin of the Ordnance Survey National Grid. Derived from OSGB NGR NORTHING,,Northing in metres from the false origin of the Ordnance Survey National Grid. Derived from OSGB NGR PIT_LOC_ACC,Location of pit,Estimate of proximity to mark on air photograph. Only applies where sites were located using aerial photo. PROFILE_DATE,Date,Date the profile was described and sampled. Currently recorded as VARCHAR(2) datatype. SITE_NGR,Nat Grid,National Grid Reference of first visit to pristine soil profile. Subsequent visits to resample will have the same site_ngr. SITE_NAME,Title,Name of locality where the profile was collected. The extent of locality ranges from small (e.g. experimental plot) to large (e.g. an island such as Lewis) SITE_NO,Title No.,Used for multiple profiles having the same site_name. Not used for re-sampling of a particular individual profile which is given the same site_name and site_no SURV_A,Surv,Lead author (soil surveyor) of profile description. ALTITUDE,Alt,Profile elevation (height) SLOPE,Slope in degrees,Slope at profile pit measured by abney level or clinometer SLOPE_FORM,,Shape of land surface crossing profile pit assessed in upslope to downslope direction. SLOPE_TYPE,,Slopes classed into two simple types (simple and complex) based on complexity of slopes around site. BEARING,Aspect - bearing,Compass measurement in degrees along the line of maximum slope passing through the profile pit. Measured down the slope. ASPECT,Aspect - degrees,Compass bearing translated to one of the 16 principal compass points ASSOC_SYMB,Assoc,Association symbol comprising two letters. The symbol was generated for the legends on paper maps when the requirement was for each map to have a unique symbol-set. Resulting from this pre-database code allocation there are a small number of repeats in the codes where different associations have the same symbol. For a unique association identifier the first 3 characters of the field SERIES_CODE should be used. SERIES_SYMB,Series,Series symbol comprising two letters. The symbol was generated for the legends on paper maps when the requirement was for each map to have a unique symbol-set. Resulting from this pre-database code allocation there are a small number of repeats where different series have the same symbol. For a unique series identifier the complete content of the field SERIES_CODE should be used. NON_SOIL,Misc map units,Grid survey sites which were not soil profiles are recorded here. Version 1 field name was MMU SERIES_CODE,,Unique numeric code for soil series. MSG,,Major soil group based on Scottish Soil Classification (1984) MSSG,,Major soil sub-group based on Scottish Soil Classification (1984) GLEY_SG,,Gleying type based on Scottish Soil Classification (1984) SOIL_PHASE,Phase,Soil phase was developed for mapping and has not been systematically applied throughout the soil profile database. The way we categorise phases of series and map units needs systemising. This will be tackled in Version 3 of the soil database. SOIL_DRAINAGE,,Natural drainage of soil profile assessed from profile morphology alone. PARENT_MATERIAL,Type of PM,Type of parent material ROCK_1_TYPE,,Primary rock type in parent material ROCK_2_TYPE,,Secondary rock type in parent material PIT_BASE,Base of pit,Reason for stopping the profile pit excavation or states whether the soil profile continues beyond the profile pit base. VEGETATION,,Vegetation according to A Key to the Common Plant Communities of Scotland J.S. Robertson (1984). FLUSHING,,Evidence of flushing [Yes or No]. Based on the plant species at the site. SITE_DRAINAGE,,Observed site hydrology in 3 classes [shedding; normal; receiving]. ROCKINESS,Rock outcrop,Rock outcrop class on land surface around profile pit. Proportion and spacing are both used. BOULDERINESS,Boulders,Surface boulder class around profile pit. Number and spacing are both taken into account. EROSION_TYPE,Erosion,Type of erosion. CLIMATE,,Climate classification according to Birse (1971). In upland areas this was often done by field modification of map classes using vegetation growth and form. LCA,,Field assessment of LCA class. SHEET_THIRD,Sheet No.,Unique number identifier for Ordnance Survey third edition map sheet that profile occurs on. DISTRICT,,Local authority district from a specific date (which was ????) BATCHID,,Analytical batch identifier for pre-NSIS_2 profiles. HORZ_ID,,Unique identifier for a horizon. Foreign key to several other tables. HORZ_POSITION,,Horizons numbered in sequence from the surface horizon down HORZ_TYPE,Profile scope,Indicates whether horizon was recorded in the field as organic or mineral. These two types have different data recorded. HORZ_SYMB_FIELD,Horizon symbol,Horizon symbol allocated in the field HORZ_TOP,,Measurement to the top of the horizon from the soil surface HORZ_BOTTOM,Depth,Measurement to the bottom of the horizon from the soil surface HORZ_PLUS,,A + sign is inserted here when the base of the horizon continued below the pit base COL_MAT,Colour,Soil matrix Munsell colour COL_PED,Colour,Soil ped Munsell colour COL_DRY,Colour,Air-dry soil Munsell colour measured in field COL_MOT1,Colour,Primary soil mottle Munsell colour MOT1_FREQ,,Frequency class of primary mottles MOT1_SIZE,,Size class of primary mottles MOT1_CON,,Contrast between colour of primary mottles and colour of soil matrix MOT1_SHAR,,Sharpness of the boundary between the primary mottles and the soil matrix judged by colour. OM,Nature of OM,Nature of organic matter - 3 classes: amorphous; semi-fibrous; fibrous. OM_MIN,,Mineral material in organic horizons HUMOSE,,Field texture humose is recorded as H. Duplicates the data in HUM_GR which was carried over from the original data tables. HUM_GR,,Superseded by humose and sand_grain fields. Will be dropped in Version 3. SAND_GRAIN,,Field assessment of sand grains size in 3 classes. Null might be interpreted as medium. Duplicates the data in HUM_GR which was carried over from the original data tables. TEX,Texture,Field texture class STRU1_DEG,,The degree of ped development of the primary ped type STRU1_SIZE,,Size class of the primary ped type STRU1_SHAPE,,Shape class of the primary ped type STRU2_DEG,,The degree of ped development of the secondary ped type STRU2_SIZE,,Size class of the secondary ped type STRU2_SHAPE,,Shape class of the secondary ped type MOIST,,Field moisture state CON_WET,,Consistence type when the field moisture state is wet CON_MOIST,,Consistence type when the field moisture state is moist CON_DRY,,Consistence type when the field moisture state is dry IND,,Strength class of induration CEM,,Strength class of cementation RTS1_FREQ,,Frequency class of the primary roots RTS1_SIZE,,Size class of the primary roots RTS1_KIND,,Type of the primary roots RTS2_FREQ,,Frequency class of the secondary roots RTS2_SIZE,,Size class of the secondary roots RTS2_KIND,,Type of the secondary roots STS1_FREQ,,Primary stones frequency class STS1_SIZE,,Primary stones size class STS1_SHAPE,,Primary stones shape class STS1_LITH,,Primary stones lithology code STS2_FREQ,,Secondary stones frequency class STS2_SIZE,,Secondary stones size class STS2_SHAPE,,Secondary stones shape class STS2_LITH,,Secondary stones lithology code BOUND_THICK,Boundary thickness,Thickness of the horizon boundary with the underlying horizon. BOUND_FORM,Boundary form,Irregularity of the horizon boundary with the underlying horizon. SAMPLE_ID,Lab Nos.,Sample identifier formerly known as LABNO SAMPLE_POSITION,,Sample position numbered from top down. Began recording this in NSIS_2 - should be complete for NSIS_1 profiles. SAMPLE_TOP,Bulk samples and Extra bulk samples,Measurement to the top of the sample from the soil surface SAMPLE_BOTTOM,Bulk samples and Extra bulk samples,Measurement to the bottom of the sample from the soil surface LOI,,Loss on ignition according to method code DP1971 CARBON,,Total carbon percentage by wet combustion or CHN analyser NITROGEN,,Total nitrogen percentage by CHN analyser CN_RATIO,,Ratio of carbon to nitrogen ORGANIC_MATTER,,Percentage organic matter content. Calculated by ROUND(C*1.721) adjusted to 100 in 5 samples where calculated value exceeds 100 USBS_FLAG,,Flag to indicate whether silt and sand boundary is USDA or BSTC i.e. 50 or 63 microns. This code is not consistently applied within the data base although the change was implemented in January 1986. UBSAND,,Sand percentage either USDA or BSTC UBSILT,,Silt percentage either USDA or BSTC SAND_INT,,Sand percentage according to the International particle size classification which has sand as 20 to 2000 microns SILT_INT,,Silt percentage according to the International particle size classification which has silt as 2 to 20 microns CLAY,,Clay percentage. Clay particles are less than 2 microns. TEXTURE_FROM_PSC,,Mineral texture class decoded from the measured particle size data. Organic content was not included and may differ from field texture assessment. PH_H2O,,pH in water PH_CACL2,,pH in 0.01M calcium chloride EXCH_CALCIUM,,Exchangeable calcium (meq per 100g air-dried soil) according to method code DP1971 EXCH_MAGNESIUM,,Exchangeable magnesium (meq per 100g air-dried soil) according to method code DP1971 EXCH_SODIUM,,Exchangeable sodium (meq per 100g air-dried soil) according to method code DP1971 EXCH_POTASSIUM,,Exchangeable potassium (meq per 100g air-dried soil) according to method code DP1971 EXCH_HYDROGEN,,Exchangeable hydrogen (meq per 100g air-dried soil) according to method code DP1971 SUM_CATIONS,,Sum of cations calculated by ROUND((ca+mg+na+k+h)1) BASE_SATURATION,,Base saturation. Appears to be calculated from ROUND((100*(ca+mg+na+k)/(ca+mg+na+k+h))1) WHERE h<>0 with 16 exceptions TOTAL_P2O5,,Total P2O5 [mg per 100g air-dry soil]. Requires a conversion to total P NIPAQUA_CALCIUM,,Calcium extracted by aqua-regia digestion [ppm in air-dried soil] NIPAQUA_SODIUM,,Sodium extracted by aqua-regia digestion [ppm in air-dried soil] NIPAQUA_POTASSIUM,,Potassium extracted by aqua-regia digestion [ppm in air-dried soil] NIPAQUA_MAGNESIUM,,Magnesium extracted by aqua-regia digestion [ppm in air-dried soil] NIPAQUA_COPPER,,Copper extracted by aqua-regia digestion [ppm in air-dried soil] NIPAQUA_ZINC,,Zinc extracted by aqua-regia digestion [ppm in air-dried soil] NIPAQUA_IRON,,Iron extracted by aqua-regia digestion [ppm in air-dried soil] NIPAQUA_MANGANESE,,Manganese extracted by aqua-regia digestion [ppm in air-dried soil] NIPAQUA_ALUMINIUM,,Aluminium extracted by aqua-regia digestion [ppm in air-dried soil] NIPAQUA_PHOSPHORUS,,Phosphorus extracted by aqua-regia digestion [ppm in air-dried soil] NIPAQUA_NICKEL,,Nickel extracted by aqua-regia digestion [ppm in air-dried soil] NIPAQUA_CADMIUM,,Cadmium extracted by aqua-regia digestion [ppm in air-dried soil] NIPAQUA_CHROMIUM,,Chromium extracted by aqua-regia digestion [ppm in air-dried soil] NIPAQUA_COBALT,,Cobalt extracted by aqua-regia digestion [ppm in air-dried soil] NIPAQUA_LEAD,,Lead extracted by aqua-regia digestion [ppm in air-dried soil] NIPAQUA_STRONTIUM,,Strontium extracted by aqua-regia digestion [ppm in air-dried soil] NIPAQUA_MOLYBDENUM,,Molybdenum extracted by aqua-regia digestion [ppm in air-dried soil] NIPAQUA_TITANIUM,,Titanium extracted by aqua-regia digestion [ppm in air-dried soil] NIPAQUA_BARIUM,,Barium extracted by aqua-regia digestion [ppm in air-dried soil] NIPEDTA_COPPER,,Copper extracted by EDTA NIPEDTA_ZINC,,Zinc extracted by EDTA NIPEDTA_MANGANESE,,Manganese extracted by EDTA NIPEDTA_NICKEL,,Nickel extracted by EDTA NIPEDTA_CADMIUM,,Cadmium extracted by EDTA NIPEDTA_CHROMIUM,,Chromium extracted by EDTA NIPEDTA_LEAD,,Lead extracted by EDTA
